intro: Matricaria chamomilla var. coronata, commonly known as the German chamomile, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flower heads with white ray florets, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, aromatic leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is widely cultivated for its calming properties and used in herbal teas and traditional medicine.
